com.alee.extended.painter
Interface Painter<E extends java.awt.Component>

Type Parameters:
E - component type
All Known Implementing Classes:
AlphaLayerPainter, BorderPainter, ColorPainter, DashedBorderPainter, DefaultPainter, GenericCellEditorPainter, HotkeyPainter, HotkeyTipPainter, NinePatchIconPainter, NinePatchStatePainter, TexturePainter, TitledBorderPainter, WebComboBoxElementPainter, WebComponentPanel.WebSelectablePanelPainter, WebStylePainter
public interface Painter<E extends java.awt.Component>

This interface provides basic methods for component background (or component parts) painting. It is supported in most of the Web-components and WebLaF UIs so that you can quickly and easily change any component view.

Since:
1.4
Author:
Mikle Garin
See Also:
DefaultPainter

Method Summary
 java.awt.Insets getMargin(E c)
          Returns margin required for visual data provided by this painter.
 java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize(E c)
          Returns preferred size required for proper painting of visual data provided by this painter.
 boolean isOpaque(E c)
          Returns whether visual data provided by this painter is opaque or not.
 void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d, java.awt.Rectangle bounds, E c)
          Paints visual data onto the component graphics.
 

Method Detail

isOpaque

boolean isOpaque(E c)
Returns whether visual data provided by this painter is opaque or not. Returned value might affect component opacity depending on painter support inside that component UI.

Parameters:
c - component to process
Returns:
true if visual data provided by this painter is opaque, false otherwise

getPreferredSize

java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize(E c)
Returns preferred size required for proper painting of visual data provided by this painter. This should not take into account any sizes not related to this painter settings (for example text size on button).

Parameters:
c - component to process
Returns:
preferred size required for proper painting of visual data provided by this painter

getMargin

java.awt.Insets getMargin(E c)
Returns margin required for visual data provided by this painter. This margin is usually added to component's margin when the final component border is calculated.

Parameters:
c - component to process
Returns:
margin required for visual data provided by this painter

paint

void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
           java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
           E c)
Paints visual data onto the component graphics. Provided graphics and component are taken directly from component UI paint method. Provided bounds are usually fake (zero location, component size) but in some cases it might be specified by componentUI.

Parameters:
g2d - component graphics
bounds - bounds for painter visual data
c - component to process
